meanings.definition: An authoritative rule of conduct or procedure
meanings.sent1: The teacher used a rubric to explain the classroom rules clearly.
meanings.sent2: The rubric at the top of the page indicated the topic of the document.
meanings.sent3: The strict rubric for the game made it challenging but fair for all players.
meanings.sent4: Following the rubric of life, he always made sure to be kind to others.
meanings.sent5: The rubric of honesty guided her actions, leading to trust from everyone.

meanings.definition: A title or heading in a document
meanings.sent1: The rubric at the beginning of the report stated the main subject.
meanings.sent2: Under the rubric 'Introduction,' the writer explained the purpose of the paper.
meanings.sent3: The rubric 'Important Information' caught the reader's attention right away.
meanings.sent4: She found the rubric 'Table of Contents' helpful in navigating the book.
meanings.sent5: The rubric 'Chapter One' hinted at the exciting content to come.

meanings.definition: A set of instructions or guidelines for grading or evaluating something
meanings.sent1: The rubric for the project outlined the criteria for success.
meanings.sent2: Using the rubric, the teacher assessed each student's performance fairly.
meanings.sent3: The detailed rubric for the art competition made the judges' job easier.
meanings.sent4: She followed the rubric carefully to ensure her essay met all the requirements.
meanings.sent5: The rubric for the dance competition highlighted the key elements to focus on.
